content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. The slope of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> on the interval from <math alttext="t equals 3"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 5"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math> is <math alttext="7 over 2"><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. If <math alttext="x open parentheses 3 close parentheses equals negative 2"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, <math alttext="x open parentheses 5 close parentheses equals 4"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>, and <math alttext="y open parentheses 3 close parentheses equals negative 8"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>3</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="y open parentheses 5 close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced></math> ?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

topic.text: 4.3: Parametric Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
